title: How to Use the Toyota Prius Intelligent ParkAssist Feature

steps.title: Drive your Toyota Prius
steps.content: Drive your Toyota Prius up until you see the spot you'd like to park in. It may be behind you or in front of you (unlike those of the Ford models, where the only thing you can do with their system is parallel park the car using it's system).

steps.title: Press the ParkAssist button near the driver's side of the dashboard.
steps.content: Press the ParkAssist button near the driver's side of the dashboard.

steps.title: Make sure that the back end of your vehicle is further forward than the spot your vehicle has been designated to be parked in.
steps.content: Make sure that the back end of your vehicle is further forward than the spot your vehicle has been designated to be parked in.

steps.title: Look at your screen up on the dashboard.
steps.content: Look at your screen up on the dashboard. The vehicle will light up spots that it thinks there is a viable enough parking space located in. Not only will it light up the screen, but it will beep to alert you that there is a parking spot nearby that it can choose. Look for spots that turn into blue square areas. The vehicle can already determine that these spots are big enough and well suited enough to park the car there.

steps.title: Touch to fine-tune the parking space you believe would be a working space to park in.
steps.content: Touch to fine-tune the parking space you believe would be a working space to park in. Use the arrow points on the screen to fine-tune the spot. Look for the "car to find out what area you may be indicating as you move around the parking lot. The arrows will "select" the spot, and will highlight the spots.

steps.title: Adjust the parking space it's designated.
steps.content: Adjust the parking space it's designated.

steps.title: Touch the OK button in the bottom right corner of the dashboard screen.
steps.content: Touch the OK button in the bottom right corner of the dashboard screen.

steps.title: Put your car in Reverse gear and only keep your foot on the brake pedal.
steps.content: Put your car in Reverse gear and only keep your foot on the brake pedal. Operate only the brake pedal, as you park the car.

steps.title: Put your foot on the brake pedal, when you've backed up far enough without running through the building or into any designated non-parking areas.
steps.content: Put your foot on the brake pedal, when you've backed up far enough without running through the building or into any designated non-parking areas.

steps.title: Cancel the guidance feature on your vehicle by pressing the X button on the display.
steps.content: Cancel the guidance feature on your vehicle by pressing the X button on the display.
